descriptionHtml:
This is my first mod, so please forgive me and all feedbacks are welcome

Courtesy of Serithi, an alternate method is suggested here:

"Or rather than replacing your .ini with this one, just open them both up and manually edit the shadows stuff in yours so it matches this file. Outright replacing your .ini files is a bad idea since there's usually differences in the new ones that you don't want."





This is designed to the fix the shadow stripping bug many of
us encounter, I DIDN'T came up with this method, these are

all out there on the Internet, on various forums.I only did

some edit to skyrimprefs ini to fix this problem, as

suggested by many talented modders and gamers(certainly much

better than myself could ever hope to be).



This file may not work for everybody and it might make the

problem even worth, but I personally think that it is worth a

shot and if you too lazy ( like me once upon a time) to look

for guides.



Remember, this is SkyrimPrefs ini so it goes in where you

save the game, back that up and replace yours with this one.


BACK UP YOUR FILE FIRST!!!


Here is my specs for reference
Display Devices
---------------
Card name: NVIDIA GeForce GT 640
Manufacturer: NVIDIA
Chip type: GeForce GT 640
VRAM: 1GB
RAM:12GB
If I did anything wrong, please do not hesitate to tell me at all, all comments welcome.
author: zbzszzzt123
